alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Monroe and north central Conecuh Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 430 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Peterman, or 13 miles northeast of Monroeville, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Peterman and Beatrice. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
